title: [Large-Scale] ICT-Based Active Learning Program to Enhance Elementary Science Critical Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental scientific concepts and basic digital device operation skills
context.additional_context: Conducted in a mobile learning environment using digital devices (tablets/smartphones), with a structure that enables formative assessment-based monitoring of the learning process

learning_goals: Students generate at least three hypotheses about a given scientific phenomenon (e.g., light refraction, plant photosynthesis) and apply logical analysis skills to write a report through a verification process meeting four or more of the five experimental design checklist items.

Students use digital collaboration tools (Padlet/Google Docs) to receive feedback from three or more peers, then write a 500+ character argumentative essay that clearly includes the scientific argumentation structure (problem definition, hypothesis, evidence, conclusion).

Over two weeks, students propose three solutions per scenario from three provided PBL scenarios (e.g., climate change response, water pollution analysis) and demonstrate critical decision-making processes achieving 10+ points out of 15 based on the teacherâ€™s evaluation rubric (problem recognition, evidence presentation, alternative comparison).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
